paragraph.paragraph:
The layout constructor provides a view of the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject objects you have defined in your system, in which the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject objects may be manipulated.

Each item in the tree represents one object. The screenshot above represents the following
/libraries/vision2/00_introduction.xml EiffelVision2 interface definition - An EV_TITLED_WINDOW containing one child, of type EV_VERTICAL_BOX. Within the vertical box there is an EV_HORIZONTAL_BOX and an EV_LIST. The list is empty, but the horizontal box contains three different objects of type EV_BUTTON.
paragraph.note: Note: The window or dialog displayed as the root of the Layout Constructor is the currently selected object in the ../64_widget_selector/index.xmlWidget Selector. To edit the contents of a different window, select the window you wish to manipulate from the ../64_widget_selector/index.xmlwidget selector.
paragraph.paragraph:
The information displayed, only shows you the structure of the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject objects , and although it gives you an indication of the final appearance of the interface you are building, you cannot see the details of the interface. i.e. color, sizes, tool tips etc.

All
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject objects displayed in here are
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop pickable , so can be easily manipulated, e.g.
/tools/eiffelbuild/how_to_s/30_delete_an_object/index.xml deleted or
/tools/eiffelbuild/how_to_s/50_reparent_an_object/index.xml reparented .
paragraph.note:
Note: If the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object in the tree has the Name property set, then the text corresponds to the name, otherwise, the text is the type of the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object .
paragraph.paragraph:
If you have just started a new project, then the layout constructor will only contain one tree item, TITLED_WINDOW.
2Expanding/Collapsing
To Expand all of the items displayed in the layout constructor, select Expand layout tree from the View menu.
Similarly, if you wish to collapse all of the items in the layout constructor, select Collapse layout tree from the View menu.

2Highlighting an ObjectAn ../02_notation.xmlobject contained in a system may be highlighted in the Layout constructor by ../02_notation.xmlpicking it, and ../02_notation.xmldropping on the button displayed at the top of the Layout Constructor. Clicking this button with the mouse has no effect. The ability to highlight an object in this fashion proves to be particularly useful when building directly into the ../60_builder_window/index.xmlbuilder window, as a particular object may be quickly highlighted, and its properties edited.
